reviews.title: Good, clean, reasonably priced hotel!
reviews.text: We stayed at Rosen Inn for 4 nights end of March, 2011 and then returned after a 7-day cruise for another 4 nights in early April, 2011. We had reviewed this hotel on this site prior to our travel, and given the reviews we booked it and we were not disappointed. The outside looks a litte dated, however the rooms have been recently renovated and was fine for myself and hubby. The bathroom is very small, however, the sink is just outside the bathroom. The first 4 nights we were there, the water in the sink was just a trickle, however, it was due to a problem from roof renovations and on our return visit, this issue had been resolved. The room was clean, offered free wi-fi, new linens and a pretty good cheap buffet breakfast. The pool area was a nice little area with towels available poolside. The only thing missing for us was a fitness area. For approx. $50.00 per night, it was definitely reasonably priced. We would return to this hotel.

reviews.title: Terrible Hotel
reviews.text: When I checked into the hotel, the security guy was at the counter talking very loud about personal business. After I arrived to my room on an elevator with a wood plank floor, I tried to wash my hands & the water pressure was so low that the water just dripped out. I looked at the towels & they were filthy. I went back down to the front desk to inform them of the issues with the room & left to get something to eat. The hotel clerk asked if the towels were grimy like it was a common complaint. When I came back, my room was open & no one was in there. All of my stuff was in there unsecured. Anyone could have walked in and taken my luggage. The water pressure was a little better but the nasty towels were still there. I had to go back down to the lobby to inform them of the new issues. Again, no apology. The clerk just said that she would give me some towels now while I was down there. By that time, it was to late to find another hotel. I ended up sleeping in my clothes because I did not want to touch anything and I did not feel safe. I informed the clerk why I was checking out early the next morning & she did not even apologize for my unhappy stay at the hotel. I paid for the one night and hoped that my vacation would get better. I emailed the manager five days ago and have not gotten a response yet.

reviews.title: Loved My Stay
reviews.text: From the pictures and the price I thought this was was going to be one of those "too good to be true" hotels and after reading the reviews, I decided to take my chances. I couldn't have been more happier! I booked my reservation over the phone via the 800# and the reservation agent was truly AWESOME! Very helpful, patient and courteous. When I arrived on 4/1/11 I continued to be pleased. The desk agent was "ok". She wasn't overly helpful or friendly, she was just doing her job. Nevertheless, I have no complaints. On our floor (9th) the hotel was still in the middle of some renovations and had a few "pardon our mess" signs but nothing to fret about. The room was great. Very spacious and awesome view. The toilet & tub/shower was small but it wasn't bad at all. I was expecting the worst based on past reviews. It was a plus that the sink was located on the outside, so I gave that a thumbs up. We bought the breakfast package so we received a ticket for the breakast buffet each morning. It was very sufficient. The location was great, walking distance to a lot of eating places and a mile down the road from Universal Studios. The concierge was very helpful as well as Sid, the agent who booked our shuttle for Universal. He was humorous and super accomodating. Overall I was extremely pleased with my stay and will definitely stay again when I return to Orlando.

reviews.title: very good stay, i will go back
reviews.text: I was there between April 6-9th 2011 and when we arrived we found some work being done on the east side of the building, the checkin was very fast and easy. We had got room 717 (7th floor). The elevators seemed to be in good shape expect for one of them that had plywood on the floor and it was a very small elevator. but the other 2 were in good shape, when we had arrived at our room, it was very clean and smelled very nice, there wasnt anything out of place like i have seen at some other motels, we we walked into our room the first thing we seen was the micro fridge and the microwave, the bathroom was rather small and the sink was located right outside of the bathroom, the air/heat worked very well. the patio window is screwed shut so no chance of getting it open. the rooms were very quiet and we never hurd any noise from the interstate or from any of the other rooms. During 2 of the evenings on 4 seperate occasions someone was sliding little flyers out for local pizza places under the doors. the next morning we got up and went into the resturaunt and had breakfast off of the buffet and all the food was well cooked and for a little over 5 dollars per adult its something not to pass up and our child ate for free. the waitress on the first day was working by her self and the service wasnt the best but she was trying to do all she could do. The pool was clean and open during our stay there and we only used the pool once and the pool was warm (it is heated) but if you are used to using larger towels bring your own. when we went to check out on the 9th it was fast and very easy.

reviews.title: go on you'll enjoy it....
reviews.text: we stayed at the rosen inn (rodeway) again this year for our 12th time, and i have to say it was even better than before...
We have just returned after a three week stay at Rosen Inn. I emailed prior to travelling as previous reviews suggested to... I am so glad I did.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in a perfect location.

reviews.text: Room: I requested a high floor, we received top floor end room. This was perfect. Away from traffic noise (which the aircon drowns out anyway) and no other residents passing the room. The view was absolutely amazing. We could see into Wet n Wild, across to Islands of Adventure and the skyline of downtown Orlando. It was great to wake up to this every day. In most part the room was spotless except for a couple of things left behind from previous occupants we found under the bed (receipts, hair grips) but not an issue. The hotel claims completely renovated but there was a tide mark around the bath but although this initially looked unappealing it was definitely clean. This is the best hotel bed I've ever slept in. The fridge was useful but needed defrosting as the ice compartment was taking over. Maid service every day, clean towels and bed linen.
reviews.title: Stellar staff

reviews.text: Pool: having stayed for three weeks we spent a lot of time around the pool. Its small but there are plenty of beds and used towels are always being replaced. There were a lot of people including us drinking alcohol around the pool and we had to keep going back to the room for another cold one! A pool bar would be ideal.
reviews.title: Memerable 7 night stay this visit

reviews.text: Facilities: the pub was never busy. Some bar staff add gratuity to the total and others don't so two of the same drinks would be different prices on different nights. Never used shogun. Shop is available. Breakfast was reasonable at $7 but charge extra for juice. A small gym and games room also available.
reviews.title: Excellent value for money! £36 a night you cannot grumble.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location: we had hire car which was not used every day due to so much within walking distance. There does seem to be a few derelict buildings which makes this section of I-Drive seem quiet. Great to walk to Universal. It takes about 45 minutes to walk to Pointe Orlando.
reviews.title: Fantastic for Price & Location

reviews.text: clean and quiet, has everything in it you need, 3 pools .nice beds, safe area, foods right across the street, walking distance to everything, or trolly outside hotel
reviews.title: wonderful hotel

reviews.text: Okay, my husband said we go budget this vacation, or no vacation. I read the reviews but was still quite nervous. I cannot convey the relief I felt when we arrived at this hotel! It was first and foremost - clean! Newly renovated, the rooms are appealing. Yes, the bathroom is a bit small, but for 50 bucks a night, you won't hear me complaining. Our room was incredibly equipped. For the price, we got a refrigerator, microwave, iron and ironing board, hair dryer, safe, free wi fi, plenty of storage for clothes/suitcases. I personally thought the beds were very comfy, at least in room 910. There is a nice pool, and quite frankly, I am still surprised they provided us with pool towels. If you like big beach towels, though, bring your own. Maid service was excellent. I actually thought the buffet was very good and very reasonable, considering our kids ate free! The staff was extremely friendly. We received a coupon for the Japanese restaurant for 50% off one entree from the front desk upon check in, however, on our reservation confirmation, there was a coupon for a free entree, so look to use that one. We love Hibachi, and I can honestly say this was one of the best we've had as a family. There is a shuttle, and as the other reviews state, the shuttle does go to two other hotels., and you must reserve in advance at the concierge. The good news is that this hotel gets the first pick up, so you will always have a seat. It is also the first to be dropped off back at the hotel, so you are the first off the bus in the afternoon. We only stayed half days at universal, although the shuttle only comes for pick up at Universal in the late afternoon/evening, we walked back to the hotel as it was so close! It is about a 20 minute walk depending upon how fast you walk, and well worth it! If you need to take a taxi back to the hotel, you are looking at $8 total, including tax and tip - that is a bargain! The location is perfect, we walked everywhere. The restaurants and attractions are all so close. Next time we are on vacation in Orlando, budget or no budget, we will go back - afterall, why waste your money on an expensive hotel when you can waste your money on Harry Potter wands for the kids???
reviews.title: What a relief! Budget or not, SUPER VALUE! Will stay again!

reviews.text: Bottom line: if you need a good place to sleep, shower, and relax while visiting Universal Orlando, you can't go wrong with this hotel. We don't visit Orlando to enjoy hotels. We just need something that can give us a good night sleep after a long day at the theme parks. Here are my observations:
reviews.title: Great budget hotel

reviews.text: 1. Rooms: Rather small, but clean and decent. Yeah the bathroom is small, water pressure in sink is weak and you can hear door slams from other nearby guests, but neither of that bothered us. After a long day at the parks, we were all tired. The sound of the air conditioning unit and highway noise quieted everything else. We all got a good night sleep.
reviews.title: Good, solid, budget hotel

reviews.text: 2. Location: If you're planning to go to Wet N Wild, the park is across the street from hotel. No need to drive or take a shuttle. You can also walk to Universal. It's about a mile walk. There are pedestrian designated sidewalks that will lead you to Universal, no need to share the road with motorists. There are grocery stores, restaurants, bars, amusements parks all within walking distance. No need to drive.
reviews.title: Great Location & Value
good location, pleasant stay!
reviews.text: Hotel is in an excellent location for themeparks and shopping, easy access to I4 and got to Disney, waterparks, shops etc easily. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The staff were lovely, friendly and helpful. We had breakfast at the hotel most mornings and a few beers in the bar on a couple of occassions but otherwise we were mostly out at attractions, food, drink and service was good.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, great location
reviews.text: We really enjoyed Florida and would recommend the Rosen.

reviews.title: fantastic stay! I would definately stay again!
reviews.text: This Rosen Inn is recently remodeled and our room was wonderful! It still smelled of fresh paint, and was very clean. The location was great, very close to I4 freeway entrances to go east and west. Free shuttle to Universal Studios. I took a cab back to the hotel instead of the shuttle due to a time crunch, and it was so close it only cost $7. Disneyworld was a short 15 minute drive. We had great parking at the hotel, always a spot open. Breakfast was deal! $7 for a great buffet which included tax and tip. Free wireless internet was great! There was a pool, but I never used it while I was there. There was a microwave and fridge in the room, and a wonderful flat screen tv. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone going to Orlando!

reviews.title: Clean but small
reviews.text: I traveled with my 10 and 6 year old girls to Orlando to spend Easter with my grandmother and decided to stay 2 nights at the Rosen Inn to take in Universal and Aquatica. The employees at the desk were super nice! The room was nice and the breakfast convenient and served its purpose. Myself and 2 daughters ate for $12. We can't go through mcdonalds for that price. We could see Hogwarts Castle from our window! We decided to go back to Universal on the day we checked out. I was worried about the chocolate we had purchased and asked the front desk to keep it for me. Not only did they keep it but put it in the fridge for me. Very kind of them. Everyone we encountered was pleasant, friendly and helpful. THank you to the Rosen Inn for a great 2 nights. We will be back!!

reviews.title: This is great for someone on a budget, who wants to be close to Wet 'n Wild and Universal Studios.
reviews.text: We arrived at the Rosen for two nights in Orlando as we were visiting Universal and Islands of Adventure. The room was very clean with the exception of the moldy smell that was coming from the bathroom. The bathroom was very small and there was no fan to off set the steam from taking a shower. The beds were comfortable as well as the pillows. This was worth the price, but during the two nights that we stayed the price increased each day by $10. Not worth 80 dollars a night. We paid 60 and for not spending a lot of time in our room it was reasonable. The front desk staff was NOT knowledgable about local stores or mileage to certain places. We asked two times for directions to places and it was difficult to get a solid answer.

well just got back from the rosen inn close to universal.thank you staff exellant food good location good my family enjoyed every second of our stay.saving up to go back asap.will book this hotel again.
reviews.title: THANK YOU

reviews.text: Fantastic. Loved it. Would stay again.
reviews.title: Lovet it!

reviews.text: Our room had an amazing view. Staff were SO friendly and polite. I wish we could have stayed another couple of nights. All the staff at the Rosen made a trip to Universal a trip to rememeber (and all for the right reasons!)
reviews.title: Another great stay. Thanks Rosen Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just came back this morning from a great 7 night stay at the Rosen Inn for the second time (the first time was in September 2012).
reviews.title: Stay if you don't like to get any sleep!!!!

reviews.text: I read the review of the previous poster and have to agree that the first night of my stay (April 27th to 28th) was a bit disappointing due to a large group of teenagers/young adults who were staying at the opposite end of my 7th floor room.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and great value

reviews.text: This hotel is about a 25 min walk to universal so you don't need to pay for parking there. There is also a shuttle from the hotel although it probably won't save you any time after stops. The pool was nice although I thought it would be heated. (This was at the end of October). It was chilly when I first jumped in. I think they may have turned on the heat while I was there since it seemed better the last night. It has a fridge and safe in the rooms and pillow top beds which were nice. The view was pretty good although you can't open the sliding doors from the room. (There did seem to be a very narrow balcony.) The hallways needed vacuuming and the room had someones nail clippings on the floor when I checked in. They were there for about 4 days. There is a good Japanese restaurant on site with good food and cooked in front of you so it was entertaining. I got a weekly rate from their website of around $40 a night plus tax so it is worth considering if you can get a good rate. I would stay somewhere else otherwise.
reviews.title: Not as good as I expected from the ratings

reviews.text: This hotel is a joke. I made reservations to stay from March 16 - 20. We arrived at 9:30am on Wednesday and was told that they do not allow early check in. I know that check in is at 4pm but most places have one or two rooms available for early arivals. I told the lady at the front desk that I had food in my car that would go bad and if there was a place to keep it and she told me they only had a small mini fridge and could not keep much in it. I was told to go to the parks and return at 4pm and my room would be ready. When I returned at 6pm tired and hungry I was told that there were no rooms available for me and they had moved me to another hotel. I got no phone call or sorry. I made a big stink and the manager came out and apologized and sent me to Rosen Inn at Pointe Orlando. This turned out to be a blessing because this hotel was clean and new. I would also like to point out that in line behind me was a lady with her two young daughters. This lady had made her reservation using expedia and they told her that the hotel was sold out and there were no rooms for her at all. They also sent her to Rosen Inn at Pointe Orlando and they also informed her at this hotel that she had no reservation and they were also sold out. Wow so please be careful when choosing either one of these hotels. Don't say you were never warned.
reviews.title: Terrible customer service

reviews.text: I went to Orlando for two nights with a friend to go to Universal. The rooms have been recently renovated so they were clean and we were happy. We each had a double bed that was super comfortable and the room was a good size for the two of us. Families would be cramped though. Rooms come with a microwave and mini fridge. The bathroom is very small but I liked how the sink was separate and outside the shower and toilet. It made getting ready easier. With the AAA discount we only paid $63 a night so it was a good value.
reviews.title: Nice place, good value

reviews.text: We booked the trip two weeks before we left so open hotels were limited. I'd probably look into staying somewhere else the next time I'm in Orlando but I wouldn't mind staying here again. It was a good value.
reviews.title: I expected better from reading reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The shuttle to universal is limited, it leaves at 9:05, 10:05 and 11:05 and you have to get up at 7 am to sign up for one. It's free though and only a $7 taxi ride if you don't get a shuttle reservation.
reviews.title: Short stay, Value oriented, Clean.
good location.
reviews.text: Stayed here for two weeks, basic but clean rooms with fridge etc. Staff were helpful and friendly, did what they could to meet our requests.

reviews.title: A great hotel, fab location
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel is the location, walking distance of some good places to eat and wet and wild and easy access to the I4 for the Disney parks.

reviews.title: would stay again
reviews.text: would recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Perfect
reviews.text: I picked this hotel because it was cheap and it was on International Drive. I also picked it based on trip advisor and I can tell you it was better than I expected!

reviews.title: Brilliant stay
reviews.text: I expected it not to be at the heart of International Drive (Pointe Orlando) and I also expected it to be budget like. My very first tip is to make sure you tell the Taxi's that you are staying in The Rosen Inn closest to Universal. There are a few Rosen Inn's on International Drive. We paid $45-50 for our taxi from the airport so I think its worth looking into transfers.
I have no complains about my staying at Rosen Inn.
reviews.title: Very good cost / benefit rate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are quite comfortable, clean and have all the necessary resources for a vacation family.
reviews.title: Good value! but don't ask them to call a taxi for you

reviews.text: The breakfast it is very good with a lot of options for just $7. The juices are not included on the breakfast, it is a pity, you must pay extra money for it.
reviews.title: Terrific for the price
Almost perfect
reviews.text: The location is perfect, because there are a lot of restaurants nearby the hotel, giving you a opportunity for waking around.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One of the ladies at the reception desk were not able to find out one package delivered and labeled to me for a product bought at amazon.com. But in the other hand, the other lady from the staff fix the problem with a very good competence.
reviews.title: Walking distance to Universal
